text: XXVIII .
text_tokenized: XXVIII .

text: Every object in the next day ’s journey was new and interesting to Elizabeth ; and her spirits were in a state of enjoyment ; for she had seen her sister looking so well as to banish all fear for her health , and the prospect of her northern tour was a constant source of delight .
text_tokenized: Every object in the next day ’s journey was new and interesting to Elizabeth ; and her spirits were in a state of enjoyment ; for she had seen her sister looking so well as to banish all fear for her health , and the prospect of her northern tour was a constant source of delight .

text: When they left the high road for the lane to Hunsford , every eye was in search of the Parsonage , and every turning expected to bring it in view .
text_tokenized: When they left the high road for the lane to Hunsford , every eye was in search of the Parsonage , and every turning expected to bring it in view .

text: The paling of Rosings park was their boundary on one side .
text_tokenized: The paling of Rosings park was their boundary on one side .

text: Elizabeth smiled at the recollection of all that she had heard of its inhabitants .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth smiled at the recollection of all that she had heard of its inhabitants .

text: At length the Parsonage was discernible .
text_tokenized: At length the Parsonage was discernible .

text: The garden sloping to the road , the house standing in it , the green pales and the laurel hedge , everything declared they were arriving .
text_tokenized: The garden sloping to the road , the house standing in it , the green pales and the laurel hedge , everything declared they were arriving .

text: Mr. Collins and Charlotte appeared at the door , and the carriage stopped at the small gate , which led by a short gravel walk to the house , amidst the nods and smiles of the whole party .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins and Charlotte appeared at the door , and the carriage stopped at the small gate , which led by a short gravel walk to the house , amidst the nods and smiles of the whole party .

text: In a moment they were all out of the chaise , rejoicing at the sight of each other .
text_tokenized: In a moment they were all out of the chaise , rejoicing at the sight of each other .

text: Mrs. Collins welcomed her friend with the liveliest pleasure , and Elizabeth was more and more satisfied with coming , when she found herself so affectionately received .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Collins welcomed her friend with the liveliest pleasure , and Elizabeth was more and more satisfied with coming , when she found herself so affectionately received .

text: She saw instantly that her cousin ’s manners were not altered by his marriage : his formal civility was just what it had been ; and he detained her some minutes at the gate to hear and satisfy his inquiries after all her family .
text_tokenized: She saw instantly that her cousin ’s manners were not altered by his marriage : his formal civility was just what it had been ; and he detained her some minutes at the gate to hear and satisfy his inquiries after all her family .

text: They were then , with no other delay than his pointing out the neatness of the entrance
text_tokenized: They were then , with no other delay than his pointing out the neatness of the entrance

text: , taken into the house ; and as soon as they were in the parlour , he welcomed them a second time , with ostentatious formality , to his humble abode , and punctually repeated all his wife ’s offers of refreshment .
text_tokenized: , taken into the house ; and as soon as they were in the parlour , he welcomed them a second time , with ostentatious formality , to his humble abode , and punctually repeated all his wife ’s offers of refreshment .

text: Elizabeth was prepared to see him in his glory ; and she could not help fancying that in displaying the good proportion of the room , its aspect , and its furniture , he addressed himself particularly to her , as if wishing to make her feel what she had lost in refusing him .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was prepared to see him in his glory ; and she could not help fancying that in displaying the good proportion of the room , its aspect , and its furniture , he addressed himself particularly to her , as if wishing to make her feel what she had lost in refusing him .

text: But though everything seemed neat and comfortable , she was not able to gratify him by any sigh of repentance ; and rather looked with wonder at her friend , that she could have so cheerful an air with such a companion .
text_tokenized: But though everything seemed neat and comfortable , she was not able to gratify him by any sigh of repentance ; and rather looked with wonder at her friend , that she could have so cheerful an air with such a companion .

text: When Mr. Collins said anything of which his wife might reasonably be ashamed , which certainly was not seldom , she involuntarily turned her eye on Charlotte .
text_tokenized: When Mr. Collins said anything of which his wife might reasonably be ashamed , which certainly was not seldom , she involuntarily turned her eye on Charlotte .

text: Once or twice she could discern a faint blush ; but in general Charlotte wisely did not hear .
text_tokenized: Once or twice she could discern a faint blush ; but in general Charlotte wisely did not hear .

text: After sitting long enough to admire every article of furniture in the room , from the sideboard to the fender , to give an account of their journey , and of all that had happened in London , Mr. Collins invited them to take a stroll in the garden , which was large and well laid out , and to the cultivation of which he attended himself .
text_tokenized: After sitting long enough to admire every article of furniture in the room , from the sideboard to the fender , to give an account of their journey , and of all that had happened in London , Mr. Collins invited them to take a stroll in the garden , which was large and well laid out , and to the cultivation of which he attended himself .

text: To work in his garden was one of his most respectable pleasures ; and Elizabeth admired the command of countenance with which Charlotte talked of the healthfulness of the exercise , and owned she encouraged it as much as possible .
text_tokenized: To work in his garden was one of his most respectable pleasures ; and Elizabeth admired the command of countenance with which Charlotte talked of the healthfulness of the exercise , and owned she encouraged it as much as possible .

text: Here , leading the way through every walk and cross walk , and scarcely allowing them an interval to utter the praises he asked for , every view was pointed out with a minuteness which left beauty entirely behind .
text_tokenized: Here , leading the way through every walk and cross walk , and scarcely allowing them an interval to utter the praises he asked for , every view was pointed out with a minuteness which left beauty entirely behind .

text: He could number the fields in every direction , and could tell how many trees there were in the most distant clump .
text_tokenized: He could number the fields in every direction , and could tell how many trees there were in the most distant clump .

text: But of all the views which his garden , or which the country or the kingdom could boast , none were to be compared with the prospect of Rosings , afforded by an opening in the trees that bordered the park nearly opposite the front of his house .
text_tokenized: But of all the views which his garden , or which the country or the kingdom could boast , none were to be compared with the prospect of Rosings , afforded by an opening in the trees that bordered the park nearly opposite the front of his house .

text_tokenized: It was a

text: handsome
text_tokenized: handsome

text: modern
text_tokenized: modern

text: building , well situated on rising ground
text_tokenized: building , well situated on rising ground

text: From his garden , Mr. Collins would have led them round his two meadows ; but the ladies , not having shoes to encounter the remains of a white frost , turned back ; and while Sir William accompanied him , Charlotte took her sister and friend over the house , extremely well pleased , probably , to have the opportunity of showing it without her husband ’s help .
text_tokenized: From his garden , Mr. Collins would have led them round his two meadows ; but the ladies , not having shoes to encounter the remains of a white frost , turned back ; and while Sir William accompanied him , Charlotte took her sister and friend over the house , extremely well pleased , probably , to have the opportunity of showing it without her husband ’s help .

text: It was rather small , but well built and convenient ; and everything was fitted up and arranged with a neatness and consistency , of which Elizabeth gave Charlotte all the credit .
text_tokenized: It was rather small , but well built and convenient ; and everything was fitted up and arranged with a neatness and consistency , of which Elizabeth gave Charlotte all the credit .

text: When Mr. Collins could be forgotten , there was really a great air of comfort throughout , and by Charlotte ’s evident enjoyment of it , Elizabeth supposed he must be often forgotten .
text_tokenized: When Mr. Collins could be forgotten , there was really a great air of comfort throughout , and by Charlotte ’s evident enjoyment of it , Elizabeth supposed he must be often forgotten .

text: She had already learnt that Lady Catherine was still in the country .
text_tokenized: She had already learnt that Lady Catherine was still in the country .

text: It was spoken of again while they were at dinner , when Mr. Collins joining in , observed,-- “ Yes , Miss Elizabeth , you will have the honour of seeing Lady Catherine de Bourgh on the ensuing Sunday at church , and I need not say you will be delighted with her .
text_tokenized: It was spoken of again while they were at dinner , when Mr. Collins joining in , observed,-- “ Yes , Miss Elizabeth , you will have the honour of seeing Lady Catherine de Bourgh on the ensuing Sunday at church , and I need not say you will be delighted with her .

text: She is all affability and condescension , and I doubt not but you will be honoured with some portion of her notice when service is over .
text_tokenized: She is all affability and condescension , and I doubt not but you will be honoured with some portion of her notice when service is over .

text: I have scarcely any hesitation in saying that she will include you and my sister Maria in every invitation with which she honours us during your stay here .
text_tokenized: I have scarcely any hesitation in saying that she will include you and my sister Maria in every invitation with which she honours us during your stay here .

text: Her behaviour to my dear Charlotte is charming .
text_tokenized: Her behaviour to my dear Charlotte is charming .

text: We dine at Rosings twice every week , and are never allowed to walk home .
text_tokenized: We dine at Rosings twice every week , and are never allowed to walk home .

text: Her Ladyship ’s carriage is regularly ordered for us .
text_tokenized: Her Ladyship ’s carriage is regularly ordered for us .

text: I _ should _ say , one of her Ladyship ’s carriages , for she has several . ” “ Lady Catherine is a very respectable , sensible woman , indeed , ” added Charlotte , “ and a most attentive neighbour .
text_tokenized: I _ should _ say , one of her Ladyship ’s carriages , for she has several . ” “ Lady Catherine is a very respectable , sensible woman , indeed , ” added Charlotte , “ and a most attentive neighbour .

text: “ Very true , my dear , that is exactly what I say .
text_tokenized: “ Very true , my dear , that is exactly what I say .

text: She is the sort of woman whom one can not regard with too much deference . ”
text_tokenized: She is the sort of woman whom one can not regard with too much deference . ”

text: The evening was spent chiefly in talking over Hertfordshire news , and telling again what had been already written ; and when it closed , Elizabeth , in the solitude of her chamber , had to meditate upon Charlotte ’s degree of contentment , to understand her address in guiding , and composure in bearing with , her husband , and to acknowledge that it was all done very well .
text_tokenized: The evening was spent chiefly in talking over Hertfordshire news , and telling again what had been already written ; and when it closed , Elizabeth , in the solitude of her chamber , had to meditate upon Charlotte ’s degree of contentment , to understand her address in guiding , and composure in bearing with , her husband , and to acknowledge that it was all done very well .

text: She had also to anticipate how her visit would pass , the quiet tenour of their usual employments , the vexatious interruptions of Mr. Collins , and the gaieties of their intercourse with Rosings .
text_tokenized: She had also to anticipate how her visit would pass , the quiet tenour of their usual employments , the vexatious interruptions of Mr. Collins , and the gaieties of their intercourse with Rosings .

text: A lively imagination soon settled it all .
text_tokenized: A lively imagination soon settled it all .

text: About the middle of the next day , as she was in her room getting ready for a walk , a sudden noise below seemed to speak the whole house in confusion ; and , after listening a moment , she heard somebody running upstairs in a violent hurry , and calling loudly after her .
text_tokenized: About the middle of the next day , as she was in her room getting ready for a walk , a sudden noise below seemed to speak the whole house in confusion ; and , after listening a moment , she heard somebody running upstairs in a violent hurry , and calling loudly after her .

text: She opened the door , and met Maria in the landing - place , who , breathless with agitation , cried out,-- [ Illustration : “ In Conversation with the ladies ” [ Copyright 1894 by George Allen . ]
text_tokenized: She opened the door , and met Maria in the landing - place , who , breathless with agitation , cried out,-- [ Illustration : “ In Conversation with the ladies ” [ Copyright 1894 by George Allen . ]

text: ] “ Oh , my dear Eliza !
text_tokenized: ] “ Oh , my dear Eliza !

text: pray make haste and come into the dining - room , for there is such a sight to be seen !
text_tokenized: pray make haste and come into the dining - room , for there is such a sight to be seen !

text: I will not tell you what it is .
text_tokenized: I will not tell you what it is .

text: Make
text_tokenized: Make

text: haste , and come down this moment .
text_tokenized: haste , and come down this moment .

text: Elizabeth asked questions in vain ; Maria would tell her nothing more ; and down they ran into the dining - room which fronted the lane , in quest of this wonder ; it was two ladies , stopping in a low phaeton at the garden gate .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth asked questions in vain ; Maria would tell her nothing more ; and down they ran into the dining - room which fronted the lane , in quest of this wonder ; it was two ladies , stopping in a low phaeton at the garden gate .

text: “ And is this all ? ” cried Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: “ And is this all ? ” cried Elizabeth .

text: “ I expected at least that the pigs were got into the garden , and here is nothing but Lady Catherine and her daughter ! ”
text_tokenized: “ I expected at least that the pigs were got into the garden , and here is nothing but Lady Catherine and her daughter ! ”

text: “ La !
text_tokenized: “ La !

text: my dear , ” said Maria , quite shocked at the mistake , “ it is not Lady Catherine .
text_tokenized: my dear , ” said Maria , quite shocked at the mistake , “ it is not Lady Catherine .

text: The old lady is Mrs. Jenkinson , who lives with them .
text_tokenized: The old lady is Mrs. Jenkinson , who lives with them .

text: The other is Miss De Bourgh .
text_tokenized: The other is Miss De Bourgh .

text: Only look at her .
text_tokenized: Only look at her .

text: She is quite a little creature .
text_tokenized: She is quite a little creature .

text: Who would have thought she could be so thin and small ! ”
text_tokenized: Who would have thought she could be so thin and small ! ”

text: “ She is abominably rude to keep Charlotte out of doors in all this wind .
text_tokenized: “ She is abominably rude to keep Charlotte out of doors in all this wind .

text: Why does she not come in ? ” “ Oh , Charlotte says she hardly ever does .
text_tokenized: Why does she not come in ? ” “ Oh , Charlotte says she hardly ever does .

text: It is the greatest of favours when Miss De Bourgh comes in . ”
text_tokenized: It is the greatest of favours when Miss De Bourgh comes in . ”

text: “ I like her appearance , ” said Elizabeth , struck with other ideas .
text_tokenized: “ I like her appearance , ” said Elizabeth , struck with other ideas .

text: “ She looks sickly and cross .
text_tokenized: “ She looks sickly and cross .

text: Yes , she will do for him very well .
text_tokenized: Yes , she will do for him very well .

text: She will make him a very proper wife . ”
text_tokenized: She will make him a very proper wife . ”

text: Mr. Collins and Charlotte were both standing at the gate in conversation with the ladies ; and Sir William , to Elizabeth ’s high diversion , was stationed in the doorway , in earnest contemplation of the greatness before him , and constantly bowing whenever Miss De Bourgh looked that way .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins and Charlotte were both standing at the gate in conversation with the ladies ; and Sir William , to Elizabeth ’s high diversion , was stationed in the doorway , in earnest contemplation of the greatness before him , and constantly bowing whenever Miss De Bourgh looked that way .

text: At length there was nothing more to be said ; the ladies drove on , and the others returned into the house .
text_tokenized: At length there was nothing more to be said ; the ladies drove on , and the others returned into the house .

text: Mr. Collins no sooner saw the two girls than he began to congratulate them on their good fortune , which Charlotte explained by letting them know that the whole party was asked to dine at Rosings the next day . [ Illustration : ‘ Lady Catherine , said she , you have given me a treasure . ’
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins no sooner saw the two girls than he began to congratulate them on their good fortune , which Charlotte explained by letting them know that the whole party was asked to dine at Rosings the next day . [ Illustration : ‘ Lady Catherine , said she , you have given me a treasure . ’

text: XXIX .
text_tokenized: XXIX .

text: Mr. Collins ’s triumph , in consequence of this invitation , was complete .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins ’s triumph , in consequence of this invitation , was complete .

text: The power of displaying the grandeur of his patroness to his wondering visitors , and of letting them see her civility towards himself and his wife , was exactly what he had wished for ; and that an opportunity of doing it should be given so soon was such an instance of Lady Catherine ’s condescension as he knew not how to admire enough . “ I confess , ” said he , “ that I should not have been at all surprised by her Ladyship ’s asking us on Sunday to drink tea and spend the evening at Rosings .
text_tokenized: The power of displaying the grandeur of his patroness to his wondering visitors , and of letting them see her civility towards himself and his wife , was exactly what he had wished for ; and that an opportunity of doing it should be given so soon was such an instance of Lady Catherine ’s condescension as he knew not how to admire enough . “ I confess , ” said he , “ that I should not have been at all surprised by her Ladyship ’s asking us on Sunday to drink tea and spend the evening at Rosings .

text: I rather expected , from my knowledge of her affability , that it would happen .
text_tokenized: I rather expected , from my knowledge of her affability , that it would happen .

text: But who could have foreseen such an attention as this ?
text_tokenized: But who could have foreseen such an attention as this ?

text: Who could have imagined that we should receive an invitation to dine there ( an invitation , moreover , including the whole party ) so immediately after your arrival ? ” “ I am the less surprised at what has happened , ” replied Sir William , “ from that knowledge of what the manners of the great really are , which my situation in life has allowed me to acquire .
text_tokenized: Who could have imagined that we should receive an invitation to dine there ( an invitation , moreover , including the whole party ) so immediately after your arrival ? ” “ I am the less surprised at what has happened , ” replied Sir William , “ from that knowledge of what the manners of the great really are , which my situation in life has allowed me to acquire .

text: About the court , such instances of elegant breeding are not uncommon . ” Scarcely anything was talked of the whole day or next morning but their visit to Rosings .
text_tokenized: About the court , such instances of elegant breeding are not uncommon . ” Scarcely anything was talked of the whole day or next morning but their visit to Rosings .

text: Mr. Collins was carefully instructing them in what they were to expect , that the sight of such rooms , so many servants , and so splendid a dinner , might not wholly overpower them .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins was carefully instructing them in what they were to expect , that the sight of such rooms , so many servants , and so splendid a dinner , might not wholly overpower them .

text: When the ladies were separating for the toilette , he said to Elizabeth,-- “ Do not make yourself uneasy , my dear cousin , about your apparel .
text_tokenized: When the ladies were separating for the toilette , he said to Elizabeth,-- “ Do not make yourself uneasy , my dear cousin , about your apparel .

text: Lady Catherine is far from requiring that elegance of dress in us which becomes herself and daughter .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine is far from requiring that elegance of dress in us which becomes herself and daughter .

text: I would advise you merely to put on whatever of your clothes is superior to the rest -- there is no occasion for anything more .
text_tokenized: I would advise you merely to put on whatever of your clothes is superior to the rest -- there is no occasion for anything more .

text: Lady Catherine will not think the worse of you for being simply dressed .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine will not think the worse of you for being simply dressed .

text: She likes to have the distinction of rank preserved .
text_tokenized: She likes to have the distinction of rank preserved .

text: ” While they were dressing , he came two or three times to their different doors , to recommend their being quick , as Lady Catherine very much objected to be kept waiting for her dinner .
text_tokenized: ” While they were dressing , he came two or three times to their different doors , to recommend their being quick , as Lady Catherine very much objected to be kept waiting for her dinner .

text: Such formidable accounts of her Ladyship , and her manner of living , quite frightened Maria Lucas , who had been little used to company ; and she looked forward to her introduction at Rosings with as much apprehension as her father had done to his presentation at St. James ’s .
text_tokenized: Such formidable accounts of her Ladyship , and her manner of living , quite frightened Maria Lucas , who had been little used to company ; and she looked forward to her introduction at Rosings with as much apprehension as her father had done to his presentation at St. James ’s .

text: As the weather was fine , they had a pleasant walk of about half a mile across the park .
text_tokenized: As the weather was fine , they had a pleasant walk of about half a mile across the park .

text: Every park has its beauty and its prospects ; and Elizabeth saw much to be pleased with , though she could not be in such raptures as Mr. Collins expected the scene to inspire , and was but slightly affected by his enumeration of the windows in front of the house , and his relation of what the glazing altogether had originally cost Sir Lewis de Bourgh .
text_tokenized: Every park has its beauty and its prospects ; and Elizabeth saw much to be pleased with , though she could not be in such raptures as Mr. Collins expected the scene to inspire , and was but slightly affected by his enumeration of the windows in front of the house , and his relation of what the glazing altogether had originally cost Sir Lewis de Bourgh .

text: When they ascended the steps to the hall , Maria ’s alarm was every moment increasing , and even Sir William did not look perfectly calm . Elizabeth ’s courage did not fail her .
text_tokenized: When they ascended the steps to the hall , Maria ’s alarm was every moment increasing , and even Sir William did not look perfectly calm . Elizabeth ’s courage did not fail her .

text: She had heard nothing of Lady Catherine that spoke her awful from any extraordinary talents or miraculous virtue , and the mere stateliness of money and rank she thought she could witness without trepidation .
text_tokenized: She had heard nothing of Lady Catherine that spoke her awful from any extraordinary talents or miraculous virtue , and the mere stateliness of money and rank she thought she could witness without trepidation .

text: From the entrance hall , of which Mr. Collins pointed out , with a rapturous air , the fine proportion and finished ornaments , they followed the servants through an antechamber to the room where Lady Catherine , her daughter , and Mrs. Jenkinson were sitting .
text_tokenized: From the entrance hall , of which Mr. Collins pointed out , with a rapturous air , the fine proportion and finished ornaments , they followed the servants through an antechamber to the room where Lady Catherine , her daughter , and Mrs. Jenkinson were sitting .

text: Her Ladyship , with great condescension , arose to receive them ; and as Mrs. Collins had settled it with her husband that the office of introduction should be hers , it was performed in a proper manner , without any of those apologies and thanks which he would have thought necessary .
text_tokenized: Her Ladyship , with great condescension , arose to receive them ; and as Mrs. Collins had settled it with her husband that the office of introduction should be hers , it was performed in a proper manner , without any of those apologies and thanks which he would have thought necessary .

text: In spite of having been at St. James ’s , Sir William was so completely awed by the grandeur surrounding him , that he had but just courage enough to make a very low bow , and take his seat without saying a word ; and his daughter , frightened almost out of her senses , sat on the edge of her chair , not knowing which way to look .
text_tokenized: In spite of having been at St. James ’s , Sir William was so completely awed by the grandeur surrounding him , that he had but just courage enough to make a very low bow , and take his seat without saying a word ; and his daughter , frightened almost out of her senses , sat on the edge of her chair , not knowing which way to look .

text: Elizabeth found herself quite equal to the scene , and could observe the three ladies before her composedly .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth found herself quite equal to the scene , and could observe the three ladies before her composedly .

text: Lady Catherine was a tall , large woman , with strongly - marked features , which might once have been handsome .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine was a tall , large woman , with strongly - marked features , which might once have been handsome .

text: Her air was not conciliating , nor was her manner of receiving them such as to make her visitors forget their inferior rank .
text_tokenized: Her air was not conciliating , nor was her manner of receiving them such as to make her visitors forget their inferior rank .

text: She was not rendered formidable by silence : but whatever she said was spoken in so authoritative a tone as marked her self - importance , and brought Mr. Wickham immediately to
text_tokenized: She was not rendered formidable by silence : but whatever she said was spoken in so authoritative a tone as marked her self - importance , and brought Mr. Wickham immediately to

text: Elizabeth ’s mind
text_tokenized: Elizabeth ’s mind

text: and
text_tokenized: and

text: , from the observation of the day altogether , she believed Lady Catherine to be exactly what he had represented .
text_tokenized: , from the observation of the day altogether , she believed Lady Catherine to be exactly what he had represented .

text: When , after examining the mother , in whose countenance and deportment she soon found some resemblance of Mr. Darcy , she turned her eyes on the daughter , she could almost have joined in Maria ’s astonishment at her being so thin and so small .
text_tokenized: When , after examining the mother , in whose countenance and deportment she soon found some resemblance of Mr. Darcy , she turned her eyes on the daughter , she could almost have joined in Maria ’s astonishment at her being so thin and so small .

text: There was neither in figure nor face any likeness between the ladies .
text_tokenized: There was neither in figure nor face any likeness between the ladies .

text: Miss de Bourgh was pale and sickly : her features , though not plain , were insignificant ; and she spoke very little , except in a low voice , to Mrs. Jenkinson , in whose appearance there was nothing remarkable , and who was entirely engaged in listening to what she said , and placing a screen in the proper direction before her eyes .
text_tokenized: Miss de Bourgh was pale and sickly : her features , though not plain , were insignificant ; and she spoke very little , except in a low voice , to Mrs. Jenkinson , in whose appearance there was nothing remarkable , and who was entirely engaged in listening to what she said , and placing a screen in the proper direction before her eyes .

text: After sitting a few minutes , they were all sent to one of the windows to admire the view , Mr. Collins attending them to point out its beauties , and Lady Catherine kindly informing them that it was much better worth looking at in the summer .
text_tokenized: After sitting a few minutes , they were all sent to one of the windows to admire the view , Mr. Collins attending them to point out its beauties , and Lady Catherine kindly informing them that it was much better worth looking at in the summer .

text: The dinner was exceedingly handsome , and there were all the servants , and all the articles of plate which Mr. Collins had promised ; and , as he had likewise foretold , he took his seat at the bottom of the table , by her Ladyship ’s desire , and looked as if he felt that life could furnish nothing greater .
text_tokenized: The dinner was exceedingly handsome , and there were all the servants , and all the articles of plate which Mr. Collins had promised ; and , as he had likewise foretold , he took his seat at the bottom of the table , by her Ladyship ’s desire , and looked as if he felt that life could furnish nothing greater .

text: He carved and ate and praised with delighted alacrity ; and every dish was commended first by him , and then by Sir William , who was now enough recovered to echo whatever his son - in - law said , in a manner which Elizabeth wondered Lady Catherine could bear .
text_tokenized: He carved and ate and praised with delighted alacrity ; and every dish was commended first by him , and then by Sir William , who was now enough recovered to echo whatever his son - in - law said , in a manner which Elizabeth wondered Lady Catherine could bear .

text: But Lady Catherine seemed gratified by their excessive admiration , and gave most gracious smiles , especially when any dish on the table proved a novelty to them .
text_tokenized: But Lady Catherine seemed gratified by their excessive admiration , and gave most gracious smiles , especially when any dish on the table proved a novelty to them .

text: The party did not supply much conversation .
text_tokenized: The party did not supply much conversation .

text: Elizabeth was ready to speak whenever there was an opening , but she was seated between Charlotte and Miss de Bourgh -- the former of whom was engaged in listening to Lady Catherine , and the latter said not a word to her all the dinnertime .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was ready to speak whenever there was an opening , but she was seated between Charlotte and Miss de Bourgh -- the former of whom was engaged in listening to Lady Catherine , and the latter said not a word to her all the dinnertime .

text: Mrs. Jenkinson was chiefly employed in watching how little Miss de Bourgh ate , pressing her to try some other dish and fearing she was indisposed . Maria thought speaking out of the question , and the gentlemen did nothing but eat and admire .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Jenkinson was chiefly employed in watching how little Miss de Bourgh ate , pressing her to try some other dish and fearing she was indisposed . Maria thought speaking out of the question , and the gentlemen did nothing but eat and admire .

text: When the ladies returned to the drawing - room , there was little to be done but to hear Lady Catherine talk , which she did without any intermission till coffee came in , delivering her opinion on every subject in so decisive a manner as proved that she was not used to have her judgment controverted .
text_tokenized: When the ladies returned to the drawing - room , there was little to be done but to hear Lady Catherine talk , which she did without any intermission till coffee came in , delivering her opinion on every subject in so decisive a manner as proved that she was not used to have her judgment controverted .

text: She inquired into Charlotte ’s domestic concerns familiarly and minutely , and gave her a great deal of advice as to the management of them all ; told her how everything ought to be regulated in so small a family as hers , and instructed her as to the care of her cows and her poultry .
text_tokenized: She inquired into Charlotte ’s domestic concerns familiarly and minutely , and gave her a great deal of advice as to the management of them all ; told her how everything ought to be regulated in so small a family as hers , and instructed her as to the care of her cows and her poultry .

text: Elizabeth found that nothing was beneath this great lady ’s attention which could furnish her with an occasion for dictating to others .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth found that nothing was beneath this great lady ’s attention which could furnish her with an occasion for dictating to others .

text: In the intervals of her discourse with Mrs. Collins , she addressed a variety of questions to Maria and Elizabeth , but especially to the latter , of whose connections she knew
text_tokenized: In the intervals of her discourse with Mrs. Collins , she addressed a variety of questions to Maria and Elizabeth , but especially to the latter , of whose connections she knew

text: the least , and who , she observed to Mrs. Collins , was a very genteel , pretty kind of girl .
text_tokenized: the least , and who , she observed to Mrs. Collins , was a very genteel , pretty kind of girl .

text: She asked her at different times how many sisters she had , whether they were older or younger than herself , whether any of them were likely to be married , whether they were handsome , where they had been educated , what carriage her father kept , and what had been her mother ’s maiden name ?
text_tokenized: She asked her at different times how many sisters she had , whether they were older or younger than herself , whether any of them were likely to be married , whether they were handsome , where they had been educated , what carriage her father kept , and what had been her mother ’s maiden name ?

text: Elizabeth felt all the impertinence of her questions , but answered them very composedly .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth felt all the impertinence of her questions , but answered them very composedly .

text: Lady Catherine then observed,--
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine then observed,--

text: “ Your father ’s estate is entailed on Mr. Collins , I think ?
text_tokenized: “ Your father ’s estate is entailed on Mr. Collins , I think ?

text: For your sake , ” turning to Charlotte , “ I am glad of it ; but otherwise I see no occasion for entailing estates from the female line .
text_tokenized: For your sake , ” turning to Charlotte , “ I am glad of it ; but otherwise I see no occasion for entailing estates from the female line .

text: It was not thought necessary in Sir Lewis de Bourgh ’s family .
text_tokenized: It was not thought necessary in Sir Lewis de Bourgh ’s family .

text: Do you play and sing , Miss Bennet ? ” “ A little . ”
text_tokenized: Do you play and sing , Miss Bennet ? ” “ A little . ”

text: “ Oh then -- some time or other we shall be happy to hear you .
text_tokenized: “ Oh then -- some time or other we shall be happy to hear you .

text: Our instrument is a capital one , probably superior to ---- you shall try it some day .
text_tokenized: Our instrument is a capital one , probably superior to ---- you shall try it some day .

text: Do your sisters play and sing ? ” “ One of them does . ”
text_tokenized: Do your sisters play and sing ? ” “ One of them does . ”

text: “ Why did not you all learn ?
text_tokenized: “ Why did not you all learn ?

text: You ought all to have learned .
text_tokenized: You ought all to have learned .

text: The Miss Webbs all play , and their father has not so good an income as yours .
text_tokenized: The Miss Webbs all play , and their father has not so good an income as yours .

text: Do you draw ? ” “ No , not at all . ”
text_tokenized: Do you draw ? ” “ No , not at all . ”

text: “ What , none of you ? ” “ Not one . ” “ That is very strange .
text_tokenized: “ What , none of you ? ” “ Not one . ” “ That is very strange .

text: But I suppose you had no opportunity .
text_tokenized: But I suppose you had no opportunity .

text: Your mother should have taken you to town every spring for the benefit of masters . ”
text_tokenized: Your mother should have taken you to town every spring for the benefit of masters . ”

text: “ My mother would have no objection , but my father hates London . ”
text_tokenized: “ My mother would have no objection , but my father hates London . ”

text: “ Has your governess left you ? ”
text_tokenized: “ Has your governess left you ? ”

text: “ We never had any governess . ” “ No governess !
text_tokenized: “ We never had any governess . ” “ No governess !

text: How was that possible ?
text_tokenized: How was that possible ?

text: Five daughters brought up at home without a governess !
text_tokenized: Five daughters brought up at home without a governess !

text: I never heard of such a thing .
text_tokenized: I never heard of such a thing .

text: Your mother must have been quite a slave to your education . ”
text_tokenized: Your mother must have been quite a slave to your education . ”

text: Elizabeth could hardly help smiling , as she assured her that had not been the case .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth could hardly help smiling , as she assured her that had not been the case .

text: “ Then who taught you ?
text_tokenized: “ Then who taught you ?

text: who attended to you ?
text_tokenized: who attended to you ?

text: Without a governess , you must have been neglected .
text_tokenized: Without a governess , you must have been neglected .

text: “ Compared with some families , I believe we were ; but such of us as wished to learn never wanted the means .
text_tokenized: “ Compared with some families , I believe we were ; but such of us as wished to learn never wanted the means .

text: We were always encouraged to read , and had all the masters that were necessary .
text_tokenized: We were always encouraged to read , and had all the masters that were necessary .

text: Those who chose to be idle
text_tokenized: Those who chose to be idle

text: certainly might .
text_tokenized: certainly might .

text: “ Ay , no doubt : but that is what a governess will prevent ; and if I had known your mother , I should have advised her most strenuously to engage
text_tokenized: “ Ay , no doubt : but that is what a governess will prevent ; and if I had known your mother , I should have advised her most strenuously to engage

text: one
text_tokenized: one

text: I always say that nothing is to be done in education without steady and regular instruction , and nobody but a governess can give it .
text_tokenized: I always say that nothing is to be done in education without steady and regular instruction , and nobody but a governess can give it .

text: It is wonderful how many families I have been the means of supplying in that way .
text_tokenized: It is wonderful how many families I have been the means of supplying in that way .

text: I am always glad to get a young person well placed out .
text_tokenized: I am always glad to get a young person well placed out .

text: Four nieces of Mrs. Jenkinson are most delightfully situated through my means ; and it was but the other day that I recommended another young person , who was merely accidentally mentioned to me , and the family are quite delighted with her .
text_tokenized: Four nieces of Mrs. Jenkinson are most delightfully situated through my means ; and it was but the other day that I recommended another young person , who was merely accidentally mentioned to me , and the family are quite delighted with her .

text: Mrs. Collins , did I tell you of Lady Metcalfe ’s calling yesterday to thank me ?
text_tokenized: Mrs. Collins , did I tell you of Lady Metcalfe ’s calling yesterday to thank me ?

text: She finds Miss Pope a treasure .
text_tokenized: She finds Miss Pope a treasure .

text: ‘ Lady Catherine , ’ said she , ‘ you have given me a treasure . ’
text_tokenized: ‘ Lady Catherine , ’ said she , ‘ you have given me a treasure . ’

text: Are any of your younger sisters out , Miss Bennet ? ”
text_tokenized: Are any of your younger sisters out , Miss Bennet ? ”

text: “ Yes , ma’am , all . ”
text_tokenized: “ Yes , ma’am , all . ”

text: “ All !
text_tokenized: “ All !

text: What , all five out at once ?
text_tokenized: What , all five out at once ?

text: Very odd !
text_tokenized: Very odd !

text: And you only the second .
text_tokenized: And you only the second .

text: The younger ones out before the elder are married !
text_tokenized: The younger ones out before the elder are married !

text: Your younger sisters must be very young ? ”
text_tokenized: Your younger sisters must be very young ? ”

text: “ Yes , my youngest is not sixteen .
text_tokenized: “ Yes , my youngest is not sixteen .

text: Perhaps _ she _ is full young to be much in company .
text_tokenized: Perhaps _ she _ is full young to be much in company .

text: But really , ma’am , I think it would be very hard upon younger sisters that they should not have their share of society and amusement , because the elder may not have the means or inclination to marry early .
text_tokenized: But really , ma’am , I think it would be very hard upon younger sisters that they should not have their share of society and amusement , because the elder may not have the means or inclination to marry early .

text: The last born has as good a right to the pleasures of youth as the first .
text_tokenized: The last born has as good a right to the pleasures of youth as the first .

text: And to be kept back on _ such _ a motive
text_tokenized: And to be kept back on _ such _ a motive

text: I think it would not be very likely to promote sisterly affection or delicacy of mind . ”
text_tokenized: I think it would not be very likely to promote sisterly affection or delicacy of mind . ”

text: “ Upon my word , ” said her Ladyship , “ you give your opinion very decidedly for so young a person .
text_tokenized: “ Upon my word , ” said her Ladyship , “ you give your opinion very decidedly for so young a person .

text: Pray , what is your age ?
text_tokenized: Pray , what is your age ?

text: “ With three younger sisters grown up , ” replied Elizabeth , smiling , “ your Ladyship can hardly expect me to own it . ”
text_tokenized: “ With three younger sisters grown up , ” replied Elizabeth , smiling , “ your Ladyship can hardly expect me to own it . ”

text: Lady Catherine seemed quite astonished at not receiving a direct answer ; and Elizabeth suspected herself to be the first creature who had ever dared to trifle with so much dignified impertinence .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine seemed quite astonished at not receiving a direct answer ; and Elizabeth suspected herself to be the first creature who had ever dared to trifle with so much dignified impertinence .

text: “ You can not be more than twenty , I am sure,--therefore you need not conceal your age . ” “ I am not one - and - twenty . ” When the gentlemen had joined them , and tea was over , the card tables were placed .
text_tokenized: “ You can not be more than twenty , I am sure,--therefore you need not conceal your age . ” “ I am not one - and - twenty . ” When the gentlemen had joined them , and tea was over , the card tables were placed .

text: Lady Catherine , Sir William , and Mr. and Mrs. Collins sat down to quadrille ; and as Miss De Bourgh chose to play at cassino
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine , Sir William , and Mr. and Mrs. Collins sat down to quadrille ; and as Miss De Bourgh chose to play at cassino

text: , the two girls had the honour of assisting Mrs. Jenkinson to make up her party .
text_tokenized: , the two girls had the honour of assisting Mrs. Jenkinson to make up her party .

text: Their table was superlatively stupid .
text_tokenized: Their table was superlatively stupid .

text: Scarcely a syllable was uttered that did not relate to the game , except when Mrs. Jenkinson expressed her fears of Miss De Bourgh ’s being too hot or too cold , or having too much or too little light .
text_tokenized: Scarcely a syllable was uttered that did not relate to the game , except when Mrs. Jenkinson expressed her fears of Miss De Bourgh ’s being too hot or too cold , or having too much or too little light .

text: A great deal more passed at the other table .
text_tokenized: A great deal more passed at the other table .

text: Lady Catherine was generally speaking -- stating the mistakes of the three others , or relating some anecdote of herself .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine was generally speaking -- stating the mistakes of the three others , or relating some anecdote of herself .

text: Mr. Collins was employed in agreeing to everything her Ladyship said , thanking her for every fish he won , and apologizing if he thought he won too many .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins was employed in agreeing to everything her Ladyship said , thanking her for every fish he won , and apologizing if he thought he won too many .

text: Sir William did not say much .
text_tokenized: Sir William did not say much .

text: He was storing his memory with anecdotes and noble names .
text_tokenized: He was storing his memory with anecdotes and noble names .

text: When Lady Catherine and her daughter had played as long as they chose , the tables were broken up , the carriage was offered to Mrs. Collins , gratefully accepted , and immediately ordered .
text_tokenized: When Lady Catherine and her daughter had played as long as they chose , the tables were broken up , the carriage was offered to Mrs. Collins , gratefully accepted , and immediately ordered .

text: The party then gathered round the fire to hear Lady Catherine determine what weather they were to have on the morrow .
text_tokenized: The party then gathered round the fire to hear Lady Catherine determine what weather they were to have on the morrow .

text: From these instructions they were summoned by the arrival of the coach ; and with many speeches of thankfulness on Mr. Collins ’s side , and as many bows on Sir William ’s , they departed .
text_tokenized: From these instructions they were summoned by the arrival of the coach ; and with many speeches of thankfulness on Mr. Collins ’s side , and as many bows on Sir William ’s , they departed .

text: As soon as they had driven from the door , Elizabeth was called on by her cousin to give her opinion of all that she had seen at Rosings , which , for Charlotte ’s sake , she made more favourable than it really was .
text_tokenized: As soon as they had driven from the door , Elizabeth was called on by her cousin to give her opinion of all that she had seen at Rosings , which , for Charlotte ’s sake , she made more favourable than it really was .

text: But her commendation , though costing her some trouble , could by no means satisfy Mr. Collins , and he was very soon obliged to take her Ladyship ’s praise into his own hands .
text_tokenized: But her commendation , though costing her some trouble , could by no means satisfy Mr. Collins , and he was very soon obliged to take her Ladyship ’s praise into his own hands .
